|oui=00:24:C8 |oui_eth=00:24:C8 |default_ch= }} [http://www.motorola.com/staticfiles/Consumers/Products/DSL%20Modems%20and%20Gateways/Motorola%20Netopia%202247NWG-VGx%20ADSL2+%20Modem-Router/_Documents/Static%20Files/2247-62-User-Guide-US-EN.pdf Manual]
While the unit shown below has no FCC / IC ID on it's label (though, there is an FCC Reg. ID), it appears they are the ones noted in the infobox.
The CPU is an '''Infineon''' PSB7200ZDW (rebranded '''Texas Instruments''' TNETD7200ZDW). The wireless MAC/BB is an '''Infineon''' PSB1350AZGU (rebranded '''Texas Instruments''' TNETW1350A) and the wireless RF chip is an '''Infineon''' PSB3422 (rebranded '''Texas Instruments''' TNETW3422).
"250-539400-402 B" is silkscreened on the main board. "250-539200-402" is silkscreened on the wireless module. This is clearly an '''Aztech''' device.
The default SSID format may be '''XXXX XXXX''' where all '''X'''s are random numbers. Alternatively, the SSID may start with 7245 and the second group of '''X'''s may be random.. An example SSID is '''7245 6230'''.
